title: A bike trip..
content:
I'll be away for a while, so I'm not dead (at least yet!).
I'll be going for 140 km biking trip. And another 140 km back home.. The longest trip I've ever done is ~10 km. :\ I hope I can survive this. And by biking I mean going with bicycle and using feet..
See you at late evening 7th June! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: A bike trip..
content:
And now I understand your previous post. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

Cycling is cool, but I imagine cycling 140km is very hard. I walked 15 miles once... but that's another story. Have fun! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.

title: Re: A bike trip..
content:
I haven't ridden my bike for sooo long. I should go for a ride some day...

Are you going on your bike trip with anyone else, or is it just you and your bike, KeenRush?

Have fun and see you when you return![url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Trippy, as it were.
content:
Sounds like fun.

I went on the Great Victorian Bike Ride back at the end of 2000, which went for ten days... the longest leg of that journey was 100km over two particularly chunky mountains. That was a looooong day. Before then the furthest I'd ridden at once was probably even less than 10km.

Anyway, enjoy. See you upon your return.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"You are so afraid to live--so afraid of life itself--that you've given up the very nature of your being in trade for security."
-CWG Book 3, Neale Donald Walsh

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Trippy, as it were.
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Hiya again guys.. The start of the trip didn't went well. Yeah, I was with one guy and his girlfriend because they asked me and I had known this guy from school for years.
Anyways, when we were supposed to leave it took two hours from that because of allkinds of stuff. When we left the sky was gray and it rained couple of rain drops. We hoped it wouldn't start raining..
When we had gone ~20 km it started to rain. We moved on hoping it to end. Finally it started raining more and more, when we were about 30 km from home. We decided to turn, since it seemed the rain doesn't end, we were all wet, and guessed we couldn't probably get fire started somewhere and probably couldn't get ourselves dry in the woods where we were supposed to sleep somewhere.
So, we decided to turn home. It was the longest kms I have ever done.. We were all wet since the beginning, it got colder and darker as well. I was sure I would die there. Couple of times I was near to drive into some ditch.
Well, somehow I made it, got home and went to sauna and hot shower.

After that, clock ~1.30 am, they called me and asked if we would go with their car. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Well, we went there by car and I just came home. Never biking for me, again..

Ouch, seems like a long trip Spleen!!You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Trippy, as it were.
content:
Strange bug here - this topic isn't showing up as new for me on the topic listing screen, even though your post is. Confusing.

Sorry to hear your biking trip didn't go too well. At least you got a hot sauna and shower when you got home. (My mum loves long, wet walks, so we regularly end up out in some desolate valley cold and soaking wet. Brrr. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img] )
